item.title: Formal notice sent to Neuberger Berman’s CEO Mr. George Walker regarding McDonald’s Corporation
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2023-03-16_0042_0800_formal_notice_to_george_walker_neuberger_berman_with_email_Redacted.pdf KEY POINT OF THIS EMAIL: I formally notified Neuberger Berman that “Neuberger Berman has invested in a company which has engaged in a pattern of racketeering activity” and that therefore “Neuberger Berman is about to commit the crime of money laundering as defined in 18 U.S.C. § 1957 and the purpose of this communication is to try to alert [them] of what has happened so far in the McDonald’s RICO case.

item.title: Money Laundering
item.description: INTERPOL - Money Laundering Click on this link to visualize the original document: INTERPOL_Money_Laundering.pdf “Going back to the roots The investigation of money laundering usually goes hand in hand with the investigation of the original crime generating the proceeds. Financial investigations aim to identify the origins, flows and whereabouts of illicit income and unmask the networks involved. Illegally acquired assets can then be frozen or confiscated and the perpetrators of both the original offences and the subsequent money laundering prosecuted.

item.title: Email sent to the F.B.I. about Xi Jinping (习近平), the President of the People’s Republic of China, and Li Keqiang (李克强), the Premier of the State Council of the People’s Republic of China.
item.description:
On 2022-03-11, I sent 3 emails to the F.B.I.

This is the second email which was sent at 16:36 Beijing time. It was sent to Messrs. Rogalski and Manjarrez. It’s about the XiJinping.fr and LiKeqiang.org websites.

From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

TO : [Mr. Rogalski’s username]@state.gov

TO : [Mr. Manjarrez’s username]@fbi.gov

SUBJECT: XiJinping.fr and LiKeqiang.org

item.title: Reply from McDonald’s Global Compliance Office
item.description: From: McDonald’s Global Compliance Office (business.integrity@us.mcd.com) Subject: Re: Have you received my communications? Please acknowledge receipt. Date received: November 19, 2019 at 01:19 (Beijing time) To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) [Victim’s first name] - Our apologies for not responding, however, it appears that we did not receive your communications. Could you provide us with the information that you previously provided? Thanks. Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2019-11-19-reply-from-mcdonalds-global-compliance-office_Redacted.

item.title: Email to McDonald’s Global Compliance Office
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: Have you received my communications? Please acknowledge receipt. Date sent: November 18, 2019, 23:16 (Beijing time) To: business.integrity@us.mcd.com (McDonald’s Global Compliance Office) Dear Sir or Madam, Have you received my communications? I would appreciate if you would confirm the receipt of the emails I’ve sent to you. Have all of the Members of the Board of McDonald’s Corporation been notified? It’s important for all of them to be notified of what’s going on.

item.title: Reply from Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation
item.description: KEY POINT OF THIS EVENT: By acknowledging that McDonald’s Corporation executives “take such inquiries seriously”, McDonald’s Corporation can’t claim plausible deniability anymore. Furthermore, the email from Ms. Santona who is the General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation is CCed to the CEO of McDonald’s Corporation Steve Easterbrook. From: Gloria Santona Subject: Re: update Date received：2015-10-21 23:47 (Beijing time +0800) To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Cc: Steve Easterbrook Thanks for your follow-up note. Of course, we take such inquiries seriously.

item.title: Email sent to Gloria Santona, General Counsel of McDonald’s Corporation, requesting an update
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: update Date sent：2015-10-21 22:45 (Beijing time +0800) To: Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com Cc: Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com Ms. Santona, I would like to give a friendly reminder that I gave McDonald’s a deadline of October 22nd 2015 midnight GMT time. So you have about 36 hours left. It was 4 entire days which is more than enough considering I’ve sent my first cease and desist letter back in 2012. On top of this, had I known that the French branch had started scamming people again, I would have at the time only given you 24 to 48 hours.

item.title: 4th formal notice sent to the executives of McDonald’s Corporation to keep warning them that McDonald’s France has engaged in a pattern of racketeering activity
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: Translation of yesterday’s email Date sent: October 21, 2015, 12:01 (Beijing time) To: Gloria SANTONA Cc: Steve.Easterbrook@us.mcd.com, Robert.Gibbs@us.mcd.com, Silvia.Lagnado@us.mcd.com, Kevin.Ozan@us.mcd.com, Jim.Sappington@us.mcd.com, Mike.Andres@us.mcd.com PLEASE FIND HERE THE TRANSLATION OF THE EMAIL I SENT YOU YESTERDAY. Mesdames, Messieurs, Dear Sir or Madam, Je vous ordonne de faire cesser immédiatement votre escroquerie en bande or
